pages.text: Sage, known for its beautiful purple flowers, is renowned for embodying wisdom, purity, and harmony. The power contained in its flowers and leaves is mentioned in many treatises on alchemy and herbalism. It is also of considerable interest to witches. $(br2)Seeds, which can be found by digging through the grass, can be grown on wet tilled dirt.
Fully matured sage, whose flowers and leaves are ready for harvesting.

pages.title: Flowers and Leaves
pages.text: Unlike $(l:plants/marigold)marigold$(/l), sage's beneficial properties are found not only in its flowers but also in its leaves. An experienced herbalist can use them to create extracts and concentrates, adding a drop of harmony and agreement to counterbalance any entropy.

pages.title: Grinding
pages.text: Sage flowers can be ground using a $(l:tools/mortar)mortar$(). In this form, they emit an even stronger aroma, and extracting their beneficial magical properties becomes easier. $(br2)For example, a harmony concentrate, based on sage, is much easier to obtain from ground flowers than from unprocessed sprigs.
